de.sub.goobi.forms

Class CalendarForm.Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.forms.CalendarForm.Cell
  • Enclosing class:
    CalendarForm

    public static class CalendarForm.Cell
extends Object
    The class Cell represents a single table cell on the calendar sheet.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected org.joda.time.LocalDate date
      The field date holds the date that this cell represents in the course of time.
      protected List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> issues
      The field issues holds the possible issues for that day.
      protected boolean onBlock
      The field onBlock contains the statement, whether the day is covered by the currently showing block (or otherwise needs to be greyed-out in the front end).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cell() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDay()
      The function getDay() returns the day of month (that is a number in 1−31) of the date the cell represents, followed by a full stop, as read-only property "day".
      List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> getIssues()
      The function getIssues() returns the issues that may have appeared on that day as read-only field “issues”.
      String getStyleClass()
      The function getStyleClass returns the CSS class names to be printed into the HTML to display the table cell state as read-only property “styleClass”.
      protected void setDate(org.joda.time.LocalDate date)
      The method setDate() sets the date represented by this calendar sheet cell.
      protected void setIssues(List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> issues)
      The method setIssues() sets the list of possible issues for the date represented by this calendar sheet cell.
      protected void setOnBlock(boolean onBlock)
      The method setOnBlock() can be used to change the piece of information whether the day is covered by the currently showing block or not.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • date

        protected org.joda.time.LocalDate date
        The field date holds the date that this cell represents in the course of time.

      • issues

        protected List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> issues
        The field issues holds the possible issues for that day.

      • onBlock

        protected boolean onBlock
        The field onBlock contains the statement, whether the day is covered by the currently showing block (or otherwise needs to be greyed-out in the front end).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell()

    • Method Detail

      • getDay

        public String getDay()
        The function getDay() returns the day of month (that is a number in 1−31) of the date the cell represents, followed by a full stop, as read-only property "day". For cells which are undefined by the calendar system, it returns the empty String.
        Returns:
        the day of month in enumerative form

      • getIssues

        public List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> getIssues()
        The function getIssues() returns the issues that may have appeared on that day as read-only field “issues”.
        Returns:
        the issues optionally appeared that day

      • getStyleClass

        public String getStyleClass()
        The function getStyleClass returns the CSS class names to be printed into the HTML to display the table cell state as read-only property “styleClass”.
        Returns:
        the cell’s CSS style class name

      • setDate

        protected void setDate(org.joda.time.LocalDate date)
        The method setDate() sets the date represented by this calendar sheet cell.
        Parameters:
        date - the date represented by this calendar sheet cell

      • setIssues

        protected void setIssues(List<CalendarForm.IssueOption> issues)
        The method setIssues() sets the list of possible issues for the date represented by this calendar sheet cell.
        Parameters:
        issues - the list of issues possible in this cell

      • setOnBlock

        protected void setOnBlock(boolean onBlock)
        The method setOnBlock() can be used to change the piece of information whether the day is covered by the currently showing block or not.
        Parameters:
        onBlock - whether the day is covered by the currently showing block
